[[Stanford University]] | doctoral_advisor = Werner Stuetzle | doctoral_students = | known_for = | prizes = | religion = | footnotes = | spouse= Lynda Hastie }} '''Trevor John Hastie''' (born 27 June 1953) is an American statistician and computer scientist. He is currently serving as the John A. Overdeck Professor of Mathematical Sciences and Professor of Statistics at the [[Stanford University]].{{cite web|url=http://www-stat.stanford.edu/people/faculty/hastie/index.html|title=Trevor J. Hastie, Department of Statistics|publisher=Stanford University|accessdate=8 April 2012}} Hastie is known for his contributions to applied statistics, especially in the field of [[machine learning]], [[data mining]], and [[bioinformatics]]. He has authored several popular books in statistical learning, including ''The Elements of Statistical Learning: Data Mining, Inference, and Prediction''. Hastie has been listed as an ISI Highly Cited Author in Mathematics by the [[ISI Web of Knowledge]]. ==Education and career== Hastie was born on 27 June 1953 in [[South Africa]].{{cite web|url=http://www.stanford.edu/~hastie/docs/resume.pdf|title=Trevor John Hastie |publisher=|accessdate=8 April 2012}} He received his B.S. in statistics from the [[Rhodes University]] in 1976 and Master's degree from [[University of Cape Town]] in 1979. Hastie joined the doctoral program at [[Stanford University]] in 1980 and received his Ph.D. in 1984 under the supervision of Werner Stuetzle. His dissertation was "Principal Curves and Surfaces". Hastie began his professional career in 1977 with the [[South African Medical Research Council]]. After receiving his Master's degree in 1979, he spent a year interning at the [[London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine]], the [[Lyndon B. Johnson Space Center|Johnson Space Center]] in Houston, and the Biomath department at [[Oxford University]]. After receiving his doctoral degree from Stanford, Hastie returned to South Africa to work with his former employer South African Medical Research Council. He returned to United States in 1986 and joined the [[Bell Labs|AT&T Bell Laboratories]] in [[Murray Hill, New Jersey|Murray Hill]], [[New Jersey]] and remained there for nine years. He joined Stanford University in 1994 as Associate Professor in Statistics and Biostatistics. He was promoted to full Professor in 1999. During the period 2006-2009, he was the Chair of Department of Statistics at Stanford University. In 2013 he was named the John A. Overdeck Professor of Mathematical Sciences. ==Awards and honors== Hastie is a Fellow of the [[Royal Statistical Society]] since 1979. He is also an elected Fellow of several professional and scholarly societies, including the [[Institute of Mathematical Statistics]],{{cite web|title=Honored IMS Fellows|url=http://imstat.org/awards/honored_fellows.htm|publisher=Institute of Mathematical Statistics|accessdate=8 April 2012}} the [[American Statistical Association]],{{cite web|title=Fellows of the ASA|url=http://www.amstat.org/awards/fellowslist.cfm|publisher=American Statistical Association|accessdate=8 April 2012}} and the South African Statistical Society. He is a recipient of 'Myrto Lefkopolou Distinguished Lectureship' award of Biostatistics Department at the [[Harvard School of Public Health]].{{cite web|title=Myrto Lefkopoulou Distinguished Lecturership|url=http://biosun1.harvard.edu/events/awards/myrto/|publisher=Department of Biostatistics, Harvard School of Public Health|accessdate=8 April 2012}} ==Publications== Hastie is a prolific author of scientific works on various topics in applied statistics, including [[statistical learning]], [[data mining]], [[Computational statistics|statistical computing]], and [[bioinformatics]]. He along with his collaborators has authored about 125 scientific articles. Many of Hastie's scientific articles were coauthored by his longtime collaborator, [[Robert Tibshirani]]. Hastie has been listed as an ISI Highly Cited Author in Mathematics by the [[ISI Web of Knowledge]].{{cite web|title=H - Research Analytics|url=http://researchanalytics.thomsonreuters.com/highlycited/names/h/|publisher=[[Thomson Reuters]]|accessdate=8 April 2012}} He has coauthored the following books: *T. Hastie and R. Tibshirani, ''Generalized Additive Models'', Chapman and Hall, 1990. *J. Chambers and T. Hastie, ''Statistical Models in S'', Wadsworth/Brooks Cole, 1991. *T. Hastie, R. Tibshirani, and J.
